Package gears.sidescroller.world.tileMaps

Class TileMap

java.lang.Object
gears.sidescroller.util.Matrix<Integer>
gears.sidescroller.util.FlyweightMatrix<AbstractTileTemplate>
gears.sidescroller.world.tileMaps.TileMap
All Implemented Interfaces:
JsonSerializable
public class TileMap extends FlyweightMatrix<AbstractTileTemplate> implements JsonSerializable
A TileMap is used to store tiles in a two-dimensional matrix. This allows for O(1) lookup for collisions, as well as fast reading and writing. This class uses the Flyweight design pattern to drastically minimize the amount of memory used to store and retrieve tile map information.

    • TileMap

      public TileMap(int w, int h)
      Creates a new TileMap of the given size.
      Parameters:
      w - the width of this TileMap, measured in tiles
      h - the height of this TileMap, measured in tiles

  • Method Details

    • addMapBoundsReachListener

      public final TileMap addMapBoundsReachListener(MapBoundsReachedListener listener)
      Adds a MapBoundsReachedListener to the TileMap. The listener will be notified whenever a MobileWorldObject passes the bounds of this TileMap.
      Parameters:
      listener - the listener to register.
      Returns:
      this, for chaining purposes

    • getWidthInPixels

      public final int getWidthInPixels()

    • getHeightInPixels

      public final int getHeightInPixels()

    • addToTileSet

      public TileMap addToTileSet(int key, AbstractTileTemplate tile)
      Adds a tile to this map's tile set. When constructing tiles from this' tile map, each cell in the map with the given key will represent a copy of the given tile.
      Parameters:
      key - the integer key to map to the given tile
      tile - the tile the given integer key represents
      Returns:
      this, for chaining purposes

    • setTile

      public TileMap setTile(int xIndex, int yIndex, int key)
      Sets the tile key for the given x- and y-indeces.
      Parameters:
      xIndex - the x-index for the tile
      yIndex - the y-index for the tile
      key - the key for a tile type in this' tile set.
      Returns:
      this, for chaining purposes

    • isTileOpen

      public final boolean isTileOpen(int xIdx, int yIdx)
      Checks to see if the tile at the given indeces is open for MobileWorldObjects to occupy.
      Parameters:
      xIdx - the x-coordinate of the tile to check, measured in index-space
      yIdx - the y-coordinate of the tile to check, measured in index-space
      Returns:
      whether or not a valid open tile exists at the given coordinates

    • spawnEntityCenter

      public final TileMap spawnEntityCenter(MobileWorldObject e)
      Attempts to set an MobileWorldObject's coordinates around the center of this TileMap.
      Parameters:
      e - the MobileWorldObject to set coordinates for
      Returns:
      this, for chaining purposes

    • spawnEntityFromDir

      public final boolean spawnEntityFromDir(MobileWorldObject e, Direction fromDir)
      Attempts to set a MobileWorldObject's coordinates along the given side of this TileMap.
      Parameters:
      e - the MobileWorldObject to attempt to set coordinates for
      fromDir - the side of this to set the MobileWorldObject's coordinates along.
      Returns:
      whether or not an open tile exists along the given side.

    • checkForCollisions

      public final boolean checkForCollisions(MobileWorldObject e)
      Checks to see if the given MobileWorldObject is inside a tile, and shoves them out if that tile is tangible. This collision checking is O(1) thanks to integer division, which is pretty cool.
      Parameters:
      e - the MobileWorldObject to check for collisions with
      Returns:
      whether or not a collision was detected

    • draw

      public final TileMap draw(Graphics g)
      Renders each tile in this TileMap on the given graphics.
      Parameters:
      g - the Graphics to render tiles on.
      Returns:
      this, for chaining purposes
